info.title: VTEX Ads API
info.description:
VTEX Ads API enables merchants and marketplace operators to manage advertising campaigns, track ad performance, and synchronize product catalogs within the VTEX Ads platform.

This API is primarily used by:
- Store developers
- Marketplace operators
- Integration partners
- Advertising platform providers

With this API you can:
- Synchronize product catalog information for advertising
- Track ad impressions, clicks, and views
- Monitor conversion events and campaign performance
- Manage ad inventory and placements

>ℹ️ Learn more about [VTEX Ads](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides).

## Before you begin

- For bulk operations (product and inventory updates), there is a limit of 500 objects per request and 3 simultaneous requests.
- The event URLs for tracking impressions, clicks and views must not be constructed manually — always use the URLs provided from `POST` [Get ads](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/rma/-publisher_id-).
- Authentication is required using `X-App-Id` and `X-Api-Key` headers. Contact [our support](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-does-vtex-support-work--2eAT5EyOvaLoHdIWDVaxC3) to obtain these credentials.

## Index

### Catalog synchronization
- `POST` [Synchronize product information](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/product/bulk/products)
- `POST` [Synchronize inventory information](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/product/bulk/inventories)

### Ads events notification
- `POST` [Track ad impressions](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/beacon/impression/-ad_id-)
- `POST` [Track ad clicks](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/beacon/click/-ad_id-)
- `POST` [Track ad views](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/beacon/view/-ad_id-)
- `POST` [Track conversions](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/beacon/conversion)

### Ads
- `POST` [Get ads](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/rma/-publisher_id-)

| Parameter name | Description | Type |
| - | - | - |
| `X-App-Id` | Publisher App ID for authorization | Authentication header |
| `X-Api-Key` | API Key for authentication | Authentication header |
| `Content-Type` | Type of the content being sent | Request header |
| `Accept` | HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header | Request header |

post.description:
Update the basic product data in the VTEX Ads catalog.

>⚠️ For each batch insert/update, a maximum of 500 objects per request and 3 simultaneous requests are allowed.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

name.example: TechBrand Laptop Model X-15 4GB 256GB SSD 15.6" Display Windows 11 - Gray

image_url.description: URL of the main product image.

gtins.description: Barcode. For Newtail Network, sending the GTIN is mandatory.

tags.description: List of product tags to be used later during ad queries (`POST` [Get ads](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/rma/-publisher_id-)) to better contextualize the search. Maximum of 10 tags per SKU, maximum of 64 characters per tag. Only works for Product campaigns.

sellers.description: List of sellers who sell that product. Maximum of 64 characters per seller.

example.name: TechBrand Laptop Model X-15 4GB 256GB SSD 15.6" Display Windows 11 - Gray
TechBrand Laptop Model X-15 4GB 256GB SSD 15.6" Display Windows 11 - Gray

schema.description: Object with messages from the server.

messages.description: List of messages from the server.

instancePath.description: Path to the property with the error.

schemaPath.description: Path to the schema validation rule.

post.description:
Update inventory information, which defines the price, promotional price, and product availability.

>⚠️ For each batch insert/update, a maximum of 500 objects per request and 3 simultaneous requests are allowed.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

store_id.description: Store identifier. If store_id is not sent, it will be interpreted that this inventory information will be used for all stores.

promotional_price.description: Promotional price of the product. Use 0 to remove the promotional price.

is_available.description: Indicates if the product is available for sale.

schema.description: Object with messages from the server.

messages.description: List of messages from the server.

instancePath.description: Path to the property with the error.

schemaPath.description: Path to the schema validation rule.

post.description:
Track when an ad is rendered or visible to a user. The event URL must not be constructed manually — always use the URL provided from `POST` [Get ads](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/vtex-ads-api#post-/v1/rma/-publisher_id-).

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user within your platform. It must remain consistent across all user touchpoints and sales channels.

session_id.description: The user's session identifier. It has a limited lifespan and helps determine when a user transitions from anonymous to identified state.

schema.description: Object with messages from the server.

messages.description: List of messages from the server.

instancePath.description: Path to the property with the error.

schemaPath.description: Path to the schema validation rule.

example.message: must match a schema in anyOf

post.description:
Track when an ad leads to a purchase. This endpoint is used to notify one or more orders (sending them in a batch).

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

session_id.description: Identification of the session in which the purchase was made, to help attribute the sale to ads.

items.description: List of items purchased in the order.

price.description: Product 'from' price. Not multiplied by quantity.

promotional_price.description: Product 'for' price (discounted price). Not multiplied by quantity.

product_id.description: Unique product identification that includes the SKU.

created_at.description: Order creation date in ISO 8601 format (UTC - no timezone).

is_company.description: Indicates if the sale was made to an individual or a company.

gender.description: Indicates customer's gender. F: female, M: male, O: other.

uf.description: Indicates the state where the order was made.

city.description: Indicates the name of the city where the customer bought.

social_id_hashed.description: Hashed user identification document, such as social ID, CPF, or CNPJ.

schema.description: Object with messages from the server.

messages.description: List of messages from the server.

instancePath.description: Path to the property with the error.

schemaPath.description: Path to the schema validation rule.

post.description:
Retrieve Product and Banner ad formats based on context and placements.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).

## Request best practices

- **HTTP persistence:** Prefer persistent connections (`Connection: keep-alive`).
- **Timeout:** Apply a 500–600 ms timeout to the ad query.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: Publisher identifier provided by your account manager

session_id.description: Persistent visitor identifier (at least 14 days). Must contain only alphanumeric characters.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user. Must contain only alphanumeric characters.

store_id.description: Filters ads based on the store's inventory. If not provided, ads with any available inventory will be returned.

context.description: Context where the ad will be displayed.

term.description: Search terms used for product searches. Required only in search context.

category_name.description: Name of the category used for targeting. Always provide the full breadcrumb path of the current category. Required only in category context.

product_sku.description: SKU ID used for targeting. Required only in product context.

brand_name.description: Name of the brand to filter products by. Required only in brand context.

placements.description: Placements are used to query multiple ads for different site regions with their own configurations.

quantity.description: Number of ads to be returned.

size.description: Expected ad size. Important when a region has a predefined size and requires a media asset fitting that size. For images: `desktop` or `mobile`. For videos: `1080p`, `720p`, `480p`, `360p`, or `320p`. Required only when types include `banner` or `sponsored_brand`.

types.description: Types of ads that can be returned in this request.

asset_types.description: Accepted media types. Only valid for banner and sponsored_brand types.

allow_sku_duplications.description: Allows the same SKU ads to appear multiple times in the same placement. Default=false.

product_attributes.description: Additional product information. Used when catalog data is incomplete and these details need to be sent during ad queries.

channel.description: Indicates the device type accessing the ad.

device_id.description: Unique device ID (screen, totem). Required only in digital_signage context.

store_name.description: Name of the store where the device is located. Required only in digital_signage context.

brand.description: Publisher's site name. Required when the publisher has multiple sites.

userAgent.description: Client environment identification (body field, not the HTTP User-Agent header). Provides meta-information about the client environment accessing the ad.

tags.description: Tags to contextualize searches (primarily for search context). Filters ads that contain at least one of the requested tags. Max 10 per SKU, 64 chars per tag. Only works with product campaigns.

skus.description: SKU filter for querying sponsored products. Note: Only sponsored product campaigns respect this filter.

dedup_campaign_ads.description: Specifies whether results should be deduplicated by campaign, so at most one ad per campaign is returned. Default=false.

dedup_ads.description: Specifies whether results should deduplicate ads across multiple placements (use only when querying multiple placements simultaneously). Default=false.

segmentation.description: Allows campaign segmentation based on user information.

schema.description: Object with ads for each placement.

additionalProperties.description: List of ads for a specific placement.

media_url.description: URL of the image or video to be displayed. Present for banner, sponsored_brand, and digital_signage ad types.

destination_url.description: Destination URL of the ad (not all ads have a destination).

click_url.description: URL of the click event beacon for the ad.

impression_url.description: URL of the impression event beacon for the ad.

view_url.description: URL of the view event beacon for the ad.

product_sku.description: Product identifier. Present when ad type is 'product'.

product_name.description: Product name. Present when ad type is 'product'.

products.description: Array of products associated with the sponsored brand. Present when ad type is 'sponsored_brand'.

items.description: Product associated with the sponsored brand.

duration.description: Duration of the ad display in seconds. Present when ad type is 'digital_signage'.

instancePath.description: Path to the property with the error.

schemaPath.description: Path to the schema validation rule.

example.message: must be equal to one of the allowed values

429.description:
Too Many Requests

Rate limit exceeded.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
